Despite people who have little or no real knowledge of the bible taking the devil’s side, we have to remember that spiritual things make no sense to they who are carnal. If one is carnally minded, they do not understand the things of spirit. They are usually too arrogant to admit that and believe that, with their imaginary superior intellect, they are capable of understanding spiritual things. Having said that, it is clear that God gave free will to humans as well as angelic beings (good and evil). In doing so, we have a great responsibility to use that free will properly, and will in fact suffer the consequences of misusing it. The world is loaded with examples of how misuse of free will has ruined, destroyed, corrupted, distorted, contaminated, and twisted many things of this world. This is besides what we blame on “the devil”. Humans, alone, can screw things up just fine without the “devil”. Humans can be their own “devil”. When humans decide to use compassion, love, forgiveness, justice, mercy, and God and spiritual things as a choice over selfishness, destruction, bitterness and anger, hatred, revenge, and violence, God wins. When humans CHOOSE with their OWN free will, all by themselves, with no “devil” to blame, selfishness, destruction, bitterness, and anger, hatred, revenge, and violence, the “devil” wins. We got to stop thinking in terms of who else to blame for the victory of “God” versus “the devil” and look at ourselves. That is what one person called the Great Controversy between Christ and Satan. Humans make their own beds and lie in them then complain about their fate and state. No wonder pseudo-intellectualism reigns in so many circles: they always invent a god or devil to blame and avoid their own responsibility. I’ll just give one example and shut up. I knew a person years ago that was in a few combat zones. In discussing God and the devil, he immediately became hostile, telling me of all the dead bodies and human suffering and destruction war created. “There’s your God” he stated bitterly. No, that’s not “God”. That’s not “the devil”. That’s HUMAN CHOICE TO MAKE WAR. Well, God didn’t come down and stop it. Why exactly would God want to come down and take our free will away? So people can COMPLAIN they don’t have free will and how “mean” and “unfair” God is? I knew a few others who also were in combat zones and other places with great trouble and horrors, and praised God that, through all that, He preserved them miraculously and helped them survive IN those things. They didn’t blame God, and were much more emotionally healthy as a result. They knew humans are crazy assholes sometimes and there is little we can do but our own job. He lets us play things out and rarely intervenes, that is true. He does at times, but who knows the criteria for his interventions. I’ve read and heard many testimonies of people who have experienced “miracles” and things that were far out of the ordinary and “coincidence”, and many other stories of how despite prayer God didn’t come through. Including in MY life. So how did it happen in some and not other situations? No one knows. I haven’t heard a really good explanation other than the trite “God’s mysterious ways” thing. That isn’t satisfactory to Christians anymore than atheists. Long answer for such a question. The devil is whatever is in humans that makes them crazy assholes. We choose. My advice is don’t waste time with dizzying philosophy; you’ll drive yourself nuts. That is what it comes down to.
